This role will be a leader in developing new innovative real-time analytic opportunities, comprehensive predictive analytic solution approaches, and relevant proposals. This role requires comprehensive knowledge of the subject matter, including predictive/real-time analytics, statistical modeling, regression analysis, automation, artificial intelligence, and information management processes within client enterprises. In addition, this key role will be responsible for analyzing and translating business IT/OT requirements into an information architecture and blueprint that solves unique business and operational solutions within manufacturing.  
Responsibilities  
·       Serve as a subject matter expert in advanced analytics and perform data analysis tasks that contribute to client’s mission and vision  
·       Creation of functional design deliverables, IoT data models, perform design walk through with client, transition solution designs to teams, and support during testing and deployment  
·       Proven track record of working autonomously to deliver high quality advanced analytics prototypes in an agile environment  
·       Solid understanding of information management, including metadata, glossaries, controlled vocabularies, master data, reference data and how application transactions and device events are influenced by these data elements  
·       Gather data requirements to create and maintain entity relationship models and logical and physical data models that conform to existing standards and conventions in support of IoT and IT/OT solutions  
·       Provide leadership and guidance with real-time data processing strategies, including steams and SCADA systems  
·       Proven experience creating optimal physical data models of datasets, creating and maintaining data maps and systems interrelationship diagrams for data domains and systems  
·       Highly skilled in conceptual, logical and physical data modeling as related to IoT and big data  
·       Collaborate with DBAs, architects, subject area owners to build scalable data solutions  
·       Partner with security architects to ensure compliance with data security and privacy mandates  
·       Develop data mapping “as-is” and “to-be” documents for data development teams to use  
·       Experience defining greenfield solutions for manufacturing IoT  
·       Research to identify effective data designs, new tools and methodologies for data analysis  
·       Maintain documentation of data models and data flows, including relationships, constraints and metadata  
·       Publish and conduct model reviews with business and technical project teams  
·       Contribute creative problem solving with the ability to present multiple solutions and potential side effects  
·       Manage data modeling oriented question and answer and collaborations sessions across various stakeholders at the client sites  
·       Work directly with clients to understand and document information requirements, analyze recommendations, develop estimates and execute a mutually developed plan  
·       Execute agile-based projects that deliver incremental value to client stakeholders and sponsors  
·       Assist within the analytics full lifecycle and lead diverse team to successfully deliver analytics and reporting to clients  
·       Proven ability to analyze and generate operational reports, metrics, and KPIs  
·       Work with Design Group clients within operations to ensure all data models are covered in analytics solution and implemented to meet agreed to requirements  
·       Demonstrated best practice leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences  
Skills and Qualifications  
Business Skills  
Exceptional communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization (with clients and leadership)  
Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus  
Strong situational analysis and decision making abilities  
A broad, enterprise-wide view of the business and varying degrees of appreciation for strategy, processes and capabilities, enabling technologies, and governance  
The ability to recognize functional / technical interdependencies and redundancies (within logical and technical data models) in support of IT/OT  
The ability to apply modeling  principles to business operations and advanced manufacturing solutions  
The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and diagrams, and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and to high-priority business issues and solutions based on data needs  
Experience using model-based representations that can be adjusted as required to collect, aggregate or disaggregate complex and conflicting information about manufacturing operations and real-time/predictable data needs  
Demonstrate critical thinking and decision making skills  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  
Technical Skills  
Extensive experience with data integration platforms, including ETL, Master Data Management, and Data Quality (Informatica BOBJ, Microsoft Data Services, SAP Data Services, or equivalents)  
Relevant experience within analytic toolsets (Microsoft BI, Tableau, Qlikview, Birst, or equivalents)  
Extensive experience with statistical and predictive analysis tools (SAS, SPSS, Sinsense, Microsoft R, or equivalents)  
Extensive experience with data analysis languages (SQL, Python, R, Julia, etc.)  
Proven experience with developing machine learning systems in a professional or academic environment  
A deep understanding of the mathematical foundations of machine learning algorithms  
Strong computer science fundamentals (notably algorithms and data structures, distributed systems and information retrieval)  
Experience with relational database technology and distributed data storage and processing systems, including big data and cloud technologies  
Ability to develop data models and supporting architectures to scale to masses of connected devices, and implementing predictive algorithms for generating insights on sensor data sets  
A strong programmer, with experience in both scripting languages and strongly typed programming languages  
A willingness to learn and use new technologies, strategies, tools, and components  
Strong written and verbal skills, with an ability to explain complex concepts to a varied audience  
Ability to develop information architectures to fulfill predictive analytic capabilities, including data modeling (Logical and Technical)  
Experience with Modern Analytics and data modeling for Self Service, Analytic Tools, Machine Learning NLP, Predictive Analytics, Custom Extensions  
Ability to use various data modeling tools (Enterprise Architect, ER/Studio, PowerDesigner, TOAD, etc.)  
Education

5+ years working as a data scientist within analytics and information management domain (Manufacturing and Operations preferred)  
Travel
